1597847864_15HwpjShZKp2dpMuZqFaariQtJvMa.body:
> [wwg1wga](#comment_14_1M8tVWMfjhezUzmRxrzyBaSiZc3QbHEJjF): I'm actually somewhat disgusted that you even brought this topic of discussion up... Smh...

If we don't ask those questions, someone else will just silently implement the censorship on top of ZeroNet.

ZeroTalk was designed on the basis of the P2P network, but with a centralized mindset. Maybe, it is because we don't yet know how to build full stack P2P applications. So my approach is to discover all possible ways: how to build as much centralized and controlled system as possible and how to avoid it.

As I said multiple times, the actual freedom of speech in the network is based on the fact that one cannot, in any way, ban, delete, hide or modify your messages and not on your beliefs that one just doesn't do it. For example, if you run your own copy of ZeroBlog, your freedom of speech is guaranteed by the math. It's not the case when you post to ZeroTalk.

1603476273_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
If a dozen developers cannot do anything without nofish, it actually means the project's failed. So, can we? That's the question...

What we can do is to improve the user experience without breaking the existing use cases as much as possible. If we succeed at this, we will be able to introduce some necessary breaking changes some time in the future. And while we just talk about nofish'es choices and write no code, we can do nothing.

I think we can start from the idea I talked you about at RuZT.

> [croatame](#comment_12_19RaaMJeGXcJzLxeKXWH9pynfjgmm33VZS): With the fork, will there be compatibility with the old ZeroNet? Or, would zites need to be recreated? What about the user keys, will they need to be recreated?

There for sure should be the backward compatibility with the existing zites.

As far as I know there was just a single major compatibility breakage in the core during the whole ZeroNet development. But it broke only a single test nofish's zite, ZeroBoard. We should keep going this way.

> [styromaniac@kxoid.bit](#comment_155_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8BdnSv3): I need a patch for the bundle you compile dependencies for, in order to use your fork.

Not sure what you mean. I run ZeroNet in Docker using the docker file from the repo. I guess my code should run just as a drop in replacement for the original py3 sources. 

In a few days, I'll upload the image to Docker Hub, and also going to try combining pre-built binaries for Windows with python code from my repo. And probably will set up the updater zite.

That was my plan for today, but I discovered some major flaws in zite updating logic and now fixing them...

We need to come to consensus about which should be the major general purpose forum in place of this one. My suggestion it should be a new forum, since I'm not aware of any existing one suitable for.

My considerations:

* It should be a general purpose forum, not an IT forum, so NetTalk, ZeroTalk Tech etc are no option.
* The engine should be ZT++, and I'm going to bring more features there.
* The owner is an active well known ZN user with IT skills.
* I prefer not being the owner of the primary key, so it's not me.
* A number of persons should have moderator privileges to manage size limits, not just the owner.

My idea is that the default site list on ZeroHello should be community-driven. There should be a dozen, or few dozens of active ZN users who can modify the list (maybe not directly, but in vote-based way).

But as long as it's not yet implemented, we should discuss the list and vote "in manual mode".
